citation.article-title: Nocardia aobensis Sp. Nov., isolated from patients in Japan

p.s: Description of Norcardia aobensis sp. nov.
Norcardia aobensis (a.o.ba.en'sis. N.L. fem. n. aobensis to pertaining to Aoba-cho, Chiba, Japan, where the type strain was isolated)
Aerobic, gram-positive, partially acid-fast, non-motile actinomycetes forming an orange to dull-orange substrate mycelium.
Aerial mycelium was not visible on most media tested, such as BHI agar and MH II agar on a diluted nutrient medium, short spore chains can be seen.
The reverse side of the colonies is orange.
Colonies are 0.3-3.0 mm in diameter after 7 days at 30 C on MH II agar plate.
Resistance to tobramycin (no growth inhibition at 10 Î¼g per disc) was observed.
Glucose is utilized, but not adonitol, arabinose, erythritol, galactose, inositol, maltose, mannose, rhamnose, sorbitol, or xylose.
Urea is hydrolyzed, but no adenine, casein, hypoxanthine, tyrosine, or xanthine.
The G+C content of DNA is 67-68 mol%.
It grows at 37 C but not 45 C.
THe type strain of Nocardia aobensis is the strain IFM 0372T (=NBRC 100429T=JCM 12352T=DSM 44805T).
